However, due to his financial instability, client has been eating instant noodles at the expense of his own health. Client has requested for a microwave so that he can incorporate more nutritious, ready-to-eat meals that are more suitable for his dietary restrictions.

description: Client is a 73 year old elderly who suffers from parkinson's disease. She requires a light weight wheelchair as the current one she has is too heavy which makes it difficult for transferring onto and off taxis when going for medical appointments. Her friend, aged 60+, who takes her to these appointments finds that she is physically less able to handle the weight of her current wheelchair. Hence, a lighter weight simple wheelchair would help to reduce the physical strain on both elderly ladies.

description: Client is currently unemployed as he is suffering from epilepsy. Client is divorced and staying by himself. He is fully dependent on the financial assistance provided by the Social Service Office for his sustenance. Client is hoping to get a personal mobility device from donation so that he can use it to work as a food deliveryman and earn some income.

name: Wheelchair

His current wheelchair is too small for his use. A bigger wheelchair would be most beneficial.

name: Freestyle Comfort Oxygen Concentrator
description: Client is has cancer patient and under our palliative care service. She hopes to get this lightweight oxygen concentrator to be able to go out with her family and friends on longer outings as these are precious quality time to her and activities she used to enjoy and really looked forward to in the past as a cancer patient for several years.  She is unable to go out for longer period of time now due to breathlessness and having to be dependent on oxygen machine as the cancer has progressed; currently, she has to bring a portable oxygen tank out which is heavy and can only last for 3 hours (has to be refilled and replaced once oxygen is used up).  This lightweight o2 concentrator can be charged and need not be refilled and replaced. She and family have difficulties affording a light weight oxygen concentrator as it is costly. Hence they are hoping to get it second hand. Refer to https://shop.lifelinecorp.com/products/freestyle-comfort-portable-oxygen-concentrator for reference Kindly contact Amanda at 84282545.
